title: 1976 Brisbane Rugby League season
text:
The 1976 <a href="Brisbane%20Rugby%20League%20premiership">Brisbane Rugby League premiership</a> was the 69th season of <a href="Brisbane">Brisbane</a>'s semi-professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> football competition. Eight teams from across Brisbane competed for the premiership, which culminated in a <a href="grand%20final">grand final</a> match between the <a href="Wests%20Panthers">Western Suburbs</a> and <a href="Easts%20Tigers">Eastern Suburbs</a> clubs.
Season summary.
Teams played each other three times, with 21 rounds of competition played. It resulted in a top five of <a href="Easts%20Tigers">Eastern Suburbs</a>, <a href="Wests%20Panthers">Western Suburbs</a>, <a href="Past%20Brothers">Past Brothers</a>, <a href="Redcliffe%20Dolphins">Redcliffe</a> and <a href="Wynnum%20Manly%20Seagulls">Wynnum-Manly</a>. However, <a href="Wynnum%20Manly%20Seagulls">Wynnum-Manly</a> and <a href="Souths%20Magpies">Southern Suburbs</a> finished the season equal on points, with Magpies defeating Seagulls in a mid-week play-off.
The 1976 season's <a href="Rothmans%20Medal">Rothmans Medal</a>list was <a href="Norths%20Devils">Northern Suburbs</a> forward <a href="Darryl%20Brohman">Darryl Brohman</a>. Brohman would later sign for Sydney club <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith</a> and feature for <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury</a> in its <a href="1984%20NSWRL%20season">1984 NSWRL grand final</a> win.
Grand Final.
Western Suburbs made it two premierships in succession, after defeating favourites Eastern Suburbs in an anticlimactic decider.
Easts' solitary point was a field goal by second-rower John Payne, who temporarily gave Tigers the lead in the first-half.
Man of the match Gary Prickett scored the opening try for Wests, with lock John Ribot scoring the second just before half-time. Wests lead 12–1 at half-time and effectively repelled all Easts' efforts in the second-half.
The match was virtually without incident. The most blatant was a high tackle by John Payne on Wests' prop, Max Williamson. Williamson had to be helped from the field, with Payne greceiving a long lecture from referee Bernie Pramberg.
Western Suburbs 16 (Tries: Gary Prickett, John Ribot. Goals: 5)
Eastern Suburbs 1 (Field goal: John Payne)
